numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice systemic barriers.
2. The systemic barriers keep rich people able to obtain a good education.
3. Some systemic barriers are legacy boosts during college admissions.
4. Some legacy boosts apply especially to top selective universities.
5. The graph is appalling.
6. The graph shows that legacy boosts keep less-fortunate people less fortunate.
7. The graph shows that legacy boosts keep rich people richer.
8. Generational wealth exists.
9. Nepotism exists.
10. I wonder why these colleges still implement legacy boosts during the college admissions process.
11. I wonder what benefit these universities get by preferring legacy students.
12. Affirmative action exists.
13. I wonder how a legacy boost and affirmative action reduce the chance of middle-class students to attend an elite university.
14. I reside in a rural area.
15. I have fellow peers.
16. My peers live in the same rural area.
17. My peers and I would most likely be unable to attend an elite university because of legacy boosts in admissions.
18. Many legacy students attend wealthy private schools.
19. My peers and I might not have resources for the admissions criteria of elite universities.
20. Wealthy private schools might have these resources readily available.
21. The headline is: Systemic barriers captivating colleges.
